skill.name: multi-cloud-architecture
skill.description: Design multi-cloud architectures using a decision framework to select and integrate services across AWS, Azure, and GCP. Use when building multi-cloud systems, avoiding vendor lock-in, or leveraging best-of-breed services from multiple providers.
skill.summary: Design multi-cloud architectures using a decision framework to select and integrate services across ...

security_audit.summary: No code execution or data access behaviors are present. The skill is documentation only and contains no network or filesystem actions.

content.user_title: Design a multi cloud architecture plan
content.value_statement: Choosing services across clouds can be slow and inconsistent. This skill provides a clear framework, comparisons, and patterns to speed decisions.
actual_capabilities: Compare equivalent services across AWS, Azure, and GCP
Recommend multi cloud patterns for DR, best of breed, and geo distribution
Outline cloud agnostic architecture layers and tooling options
Provide a phased migration strategy from assessment to optimization
List cost optimization factors and tactics across providers
limitations: Does not deploy infrastructure or generate Terraform modules
Does not provide real time pricing or region availability
Does not replace provider security reviews or compliance audits

use_cases.title: Plan a best of breed stack
use_cases.description: Select services across AWS, Azure, and GCP with clear tradeoffs.

use_cases.title: Prepare a migration roadmap
use_cases.description: Create phased steps, risks, and validation checks for migration.

use_cases.title: Review cost levers
use_cases.description: Identify pricing factors and optimization tactics by provider.

prompt_templates.title: Simple provider mapping
prompt_templates.scenario: Map my current AWS stack to Azure and GCP
prompt_templates.prompt: Map EC2, RDS, and S3 to Azure and GCP equivalents and explain any major capability differences.

prompt_templates.title: DR across clouds
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose a multi cloud DR pattern with primary in AWS and secondary in GCP, including data replication and failover steps.

prompt_templates.title: Best of breed design
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend a best of breed architecture for AI workloads, enterprise identity, and general compute across AWS, Azure, and GCP.

prompt_templates.title: Migration roadmap
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a four phase migration plan from Azure to a multi cloud setup, with key tasks and validation checks.

output_examples.input: Design a multi cloud architecture for a global SaaS product
output: Pattern: Geographic distribution with regional failover
Compute: Kubernetes across EKS, AKS, and GKE
Data: PostgreSQL with cross region replication and read replicas
Storage: S3 compatible object storage with lifecycle policies
Ops: Centralized monitoring with Prometheus and Grafana

best_practices: Define selection criteria before comparing services
Use infrastructure as code to keep environments consistent
Test disaster recovery regularly across clouds
anti_patterns: Choosing services without clear portability goals
Mixing providers without a shared monitoring plan
Skipping cost analysis for cross cloud data transfer

faq.question: Which platforms can use this skill?
faq.answer: It works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code as a planning guide.

faq.question: Does it provide exact pricing?
faq.answer: No, it describes pricing factors but does not fetch real time prices.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Terraform or CI tools?
faq.answer: It describes patterns but does not run tools or generate code.

faq.question: Does it access my cloud credentials?
faq.answer: No, it reads no files and does not access credentials.

faq.question: What if a service match is unclear?
faq.answer: State the workload needs and I will suggest closest alternatives.

faq.question: How does it compare to vendor guides?
faq.answer: It focuses on cross cloud decision making rather than a single provider.
